senses.sense: Supposing that, assuming that, in the circumstances that; used to introduce a condition or choice.
examples: If it rains, I shall get wet.
I'll do it next year —if at all.

senses.sense: (computing) In the event that a statement is true (a programming statement that acts in a similar manner).
examples: If A, then B, else C.

senses.sense: Supposing that; used with past or past perfect subjunctive indicating that the condition is closed.
examples: I would prefer it if you took your shoes off.
I would be unhappy if you had not talked with me yesterday.
If I were you, I wouldn't go there alone.

senses.sense: Supposing that; given that; supposing it is the case that.
examples: If that's true, we had better get moving!

senses.sense: Although; used to introduce a concession.
examples: He was a great friend, if a little stingy at the bar.
She won her team's admiration, if not its award, for her performance.

senses.sense: (sometimes proscribed) Whether; used to introduce a noun clause, an indirect question, that functions as the direct object of certain verbs.
examples: I don't know if I want to go or not.

senses.sense: (usually hyperbolic) Even if; even in the circumstances that.
Introducing a relevance conditional.
examples: I have leftover cake if you want some.

senses.sense: (informal) An uncertainty, possibility, condition, doubt etc.
(mathematics, logic) Short for if and only if.
examples: A rectangle is a square iff all four of its sides have the same length.

senses.sense: Obsolete spelling of if.
comparative form of iffy: more iffy
superlative form of iffy: most iffy
The state or quality of being iffy.
(slang) Of dubious authenticity, legitimacy or legality.
examples: He's selling new CD players for £20 each – that sounds a bit iffy to me.

senses.sense: Uncertain or chancy.
examples: The weather is still iffy for Saturday's shuttle launch.

senses.sense: (Islam) A kind of djinn mentioned in the Qur'an.
(Arab mythology) A demon, evil spirit, often associated with the underworld.
A species of passerine bird endemic to New Guinea, in full the blue-capped ifrit.
plural of if
